q: Ravi had ______ younger brother who taught at ______ university. He was widely regarded as ______ honorable man. Select the option with the correct sequence of articles to fill in the blanks.

The CEO's decision to downsize the workforce was considered myopic because it sacrificed long-term stability to accommodate short-term gains. Select the most appropriate option that can replace the word 'myopic' without changing the meaning of the sentence.

The average marks obtained by a class in an examination were calculated as 30.8. However, the teacher found that marks of one student were entered as 24 instead of 42. After correcting, the average becomes 31.4. How many students does the class have?

Consider the relationships: P is brother of Q. S is daughter of Q. T is sister of S. R is mother of Q. Statements: (1) R is grandmother of S (2) P is uncle of S and T (3) R has only one son (4) Q has only one daughter. Which is correct?
According to the map shown in the figure, which one of the following statements is correct?
options: The library is located to the northwest of the canteen
The hospital is located to the east of the chemistry lab
The chemistry lab is to the southeast of physics lab
The classrooms and canteen are next to each other

q: From G.K. Chesterton's 'A Piece of Chalk': Based only on the passage about things in pockets, which statement is true?
options: The author carries a mirror to reflect upon things
The author decided to write a poem on epics
The pocket-knife is described as the infant of the sword
Epics are described as too inconvenient to write

q: Lines QR and ST are parallel. The shortest distance between these lines is half the shortest distance between point P and line QR. What is the ratio of area of triangle PST to area of trapezium SQRT?
A fair six-faced dice is rolled thrice. What is the probability of rolling '6' exactly once?
A square paper is folded along dotted lines and cuts are made. Which pattern will be obtained when the paper is unfolded?
A shop has 4 distinct flavors of ice-cream. One can purchase any number of scoops. Order is inconsequential. If one wants to purchase 3 scoops, in how many ways can one make that purchase?

A program is running on a non-pipelined single processor. When an interrupt arrives, steps are: (i) Save program counter (ii) Load PC with ISR address (iii) Finish present instruction. What is the CORRECT sequence?
A partial data path of a processor is given with RA, RB, and RZ registers (32-bit). Which option(s) is/are CORRECT related to arithmetic operations using the data path?
options: Can implement operations involving two registers
Can implement operations involving one register and one immediate value
Can implement operations involving two immediate values
Can only implement operations with one register and one immediate

q: Memory system: 1M bytes main memory, 16K bytes cache, 20-bit address, block size 16 bytes, direct mapping. How many bits required to store all tag values? [1K=2^10, 1M=2^20]
A processor has 64 general-purpose registers and 50 distinct instruction types. Instruction is encoded in 32 bits. What is the maximum number of bits for immediate operand in: ADD R1, #25?
Which ONE of the following statements is FALSE regarding the symbol table?
options: Symbol table is responsible for keeping track of the scope of variables
Symbol table can be implemented using a binary search tree
Symbol table is not required after the parsing phase
Symbol table is created during the lexical analysis phase

q: Which ONE of the following techniques used in compiler code optimization uses live variable analysis?

options: For a production A ‚Üí Œµ, Œµ will be added to First(A)
If there is any input right end marker, it will be added to First(S), where S is the start symbol
For a production A ‚Üí Œµ, Œµ will be added to Follow(A)
If there is any input right end marker, it will be added to Follow(S), where S is the start symbol

Consider a demand paging memory management system with 32-bit logical address, 20-bit physical address, and page size of 2048 bytes. Assuming memory is byte addressable, what is the maximum number of entries in the page table?
A multiprogramming C program has scanf and printf in a loop (i=0 to 20). The number of times the process enters ready queue during lifetime (not counting initial entry) is:
Two processors M1, M2. Four processes with CPU bursts 20, 16, 25, 10 ms arrive simultaneously. Non-preemptive priority: M1: P1>P3>P2>P4, M2: P2>P3>P4>P1. What is average waiting time in milliseconds?

Modified optimal page replacement (predicts next 4 refs). Page sequence: 1,3,2,4,2,3,1,2,4,3,1,4. Three frames initially empty. Number of page faults:
A schedule of three transactions T1, T2, T3: R1(X) W1(Y) R2(X) R2(Y) R3(Y) ABORT(T1). Which other transaction(s) will be required to be rolled back?
B+ tree with 5 nodes, max 3 keys per node. Value 23 is inserted. Which of the following option(s) is/are CORRECT?
options: None of the nodes will split
At least one node will split and redistribute
The total number of nodes will remain same
The height of the tree will increase

q: Relations: teams(tid, tname), players(pid, pname, tid). Which tuple relational calculus query returns player names for team 'MI'?
options: {p.pname | p ‚àà players ‚àß ‚àÉt(t ‚àà teams ‚àß p.tid = t.tid ‚àß t.tname = 'MI')}

q: Relation team(name, city, owner) with FDs: name‚Üícity, name‚Üíowner. Decomposed to t1(name,city) and t2(name,owner). Which statement(s) is/are TRUE?
options: The relation team is NOT in BCNF
The relations t1 and t2 are in BCNF
The decomposition constitutes a lossless join
The relation team is NOT in 3NF

options: g(.) is not required to be one-to-one or onto

q: System of linear equations: x + ky = 1, kx + y = -1. Which of the following option(s) is/are CORRECT?
options: Exactly one value of k for which system has no solution
Infinite number of values of k with no solution
Exactly one value of k with exactly one solution
Exactly one value of k with infinite number of solutions
